OK. is the /home/<name>   directory the .dmrc is in correspond to the <name> which you are logging in as?
Did you recently copy this dir back in from someplace else without using -p switch in the cp command?
Have you been starting the machine with the Recovery kernel then trying to start the X server?
I would suggest something like:    sudo chown -R <name>:<name> /home/<name>           where <name> is the user name which corresponds to this obviously. then: sudo chmod 644 /home/<name>/.dmrc
You may also want to do:  sudo chown -R <name>:<name> /home/<name>/.*                     <-- note /.*     after <name> as different from previous command
